What is the Writing Table?

Enhance your writing practice through writing in communion

Writing Table is a space for books, dissertations, journal articles,
fiction, non-fiction, creative writing, sermons, journaling, and more.

In the early pandemic days, students, pastors, professors, and authors
were feeling a lot of stress on our writing and our lives. We needed a place to show up and be together in our work. We needed a community of practice. And so the Writing Table was born.

Join the Writing Table Annually Join the Writing Table Monthly

Meet Your Hosts

Founder

Rev. Dr. Eileen Campbell-Reed

As founder and host of the Writing Table, Eileen Campbell-Reed brings more than a decade of coaching experience, working with academic writers, and now writers in many other professions, mostly ministry-related. She is delighted each week not only to host the space but to offer gentle encouragement, coaching, and reminders about the basic skills for the writing habits that we are all building. She wrote and edited much of Pastoral
Imagination while hosting the Writing Table during the Covid-19 pandemic.

Co-Host

Rev. Traci Smith

We are so glad to welcome pastor, author and coach, Rev. Traci Smith to the Writing Table as an occasional coach. Traci is a widely recognized children's author, consultant, and friend. She has been a regular at the Writing Table for more several years, writing most all of her book, Faithful Families for Advent and Christmas.
We are lucky to have Traci hosting occasionally at the Writing Table!

Need Extra Support for Your Writing Project?

Eileen is currently available for new one-to-one coaching clients. She offers both coaching for planning your projects, and developmental coaching that offers you direct feedback on the writing itself.

And when you make that commitment to yourself to get the direct support
you need for your projects, you will also receive two, four, six, or eight
months of membership at the Writing Table — depending on how many coaching
sessions you choose. This is a great way to get layers of help and support
for your work.Visit the 3MMM shop to learn more about individual coaching options, which include membership at the Writing Table.
Or explore the options for developmental coaching plus membership at the Writing Table!

Join Annually Join Monthly

Who Is It For?

All kinds of people come to the Writing Table. Pastors who work on their sermons. Professors who are writing books. Graduate students are writing dissertations. Poets who are writing poetry. Authors who are writing articles and blogs. Dreamers who are writing down their dreams. Everyday people who want to put their ideas into the world come to the Writing Table. Anyone who wants to write for an hour can join us. We don't talk about what we're writing (unless you want to, then no one objects). We focus on strategies for building writing habits. Would like your writing to be something the more than an occasional effort? Do you like to complete a draft and have your writing published?

Then please join the writers and authors and students and preachers to strengthen and complete what you love to do.

That's one of my mentors and professors used to say to me, "I don't really love writing but I love having written." Thanks, Carolyn Blevins, for that truthful word. The best way to have written, is to start writing on a daily basis, or maybe you need three days a week or maybe you need one day a week. Wherever you are in building your habit, the Writing Table can be for you.

Join Annually Join Monthly

What Do We Do When We Gather at the Writing Table?

We write in brief sessions. Professor
Robert Boice studied over a thousand academic writers across 30 years.
In his research he learned that writing briefly and daily, holding back before writing and writing before ready, are strategies that help one to build a solid and lasting writing habit. Planning small steps and letting others do some of the work are also keys to a productive writing habit. The best writers are not binge writers (oh there are exceptions, but don’t try to be one!). They are people who see writing as part of their everyday work and keep plugging away. They learn to write without excruciating pain but instead with mild enjoyment.

So we write in small chunks (we like to use the pomodoro technique) or even for longer stretches, but with breaks. We write humanely. And by doing the work simultaneously in community, we reinforce how showing up and taking time to breathe, setting intentions and sharing our strategies, make everyone’s habit stronger.

We keep the same basic structure of timing in every writing table. Beginning and ending on time, taking a break, and sharing our strategies (and struggles) make mutual encouragement part of each gathering.

Join Annually Join Monthly

How Will It Help Me?

Since March 2020, scores of writers have joined me at the Writing Table. They have completed everything from dissertations and books to devotionals and short articles, blogs and magazine features, sermons and reports, poetry and study guides. The proof is in the success of everyone has made the commitment to show up for themselves and their writing on a regular basis.

Sure you can write on your own. You're probably already doing that. But what you'll find is by doing it collaboratively and in community, your commitment and your accomplishments will both grow.

Join Annually Join Monthly

What Are #FreeWrite Fridays?

For more than two years, Eileen hosted the Writing Table for no charge. Completely free. Anyone could come to the Writing Table, receive encouragement and support from a writing coach, and share the table with others. What we learned since March of 2020 is that doing this kind of writing in a coworking space is something people need and want. It was something Eileen truly enjoys doing!

To continue to make it possible, it is time to offer the Writing Table as a service in exchange for very reasonable fee. But also we want people to be able to try it. With no charge. And sometimes people just want to write about once a week. To make all of that possible, the Writing Table on Fridays will remain free in 2024 and probably beyond. Use the sign up form below to get the weekly link!

We are calling this offering #FreeWrite Fridays. One of the greatest strategies when you're stuck in any writing project, is not to keep pressing on with the project. It is to stop and just simply free write. Put your fingers to the key or your hand to the pen on paper and just let whatever comes out come out. Many widely published authors use this strategy to get unstuck.

If what you need the writing table for is to get unstuck then by all means join us on Fridays and give it a try. You can write anything you like from free writing to poetry the most important magnum opus. There's no judgment at the writing table only support and cheering you on. You may find that you like it so much you want to come other days of the week. And that will be possible this year by joining monthly or annually.
